knimeNode.name: Database Update
knimeNode.shortDescription: Writes the input table into a database while updating the given rows in the database.

fullDescription.intro:
Writes the input table into a database while updating the given rows in the database. All selected column names need to exactly match the column names inside the database.
Make sure you have your vendor-specific database driver registered in the KNIME preference page (section Database Driver). By default, the sun.jdbc.odbc.JdbcOdbcDriver (Windows and Linux) is only available.

tab.name: Settings
tab.option: Enter the database driver here; it is a Java class (including the package path), for example: sun.jdbc.odbc.JdbcOdbcDriver Additional driver can be registered via KNIME's preference page (Database Driver).
Enter the database name here, for example: jdbc:odbc:database_name or jdbc:mysql://host:port/database_name

If checked, the credentials (user and password) are used as defined on the workflow. The credential name links to the specified user and password. Those can be replaced or edit using the 'Workflow Credentials' menu available in the workflow context menu.
Your log-in user name for the database.
Your log-in password for the database. Note, the password is de- and encrypted before handling it internally and is not stored inside the settings.
Enter the name of the table in which the data should be updated.

tab.name: Column Selection
tab.option: Select all columns used for the SET clause of the UPDATE statement; those column values are changing the data in the database.

ports.inPort: Table with data to be updated in the database
ports.outPort: Input table with additional column providing update status received from the database
